targets.objective: Test for HTTP method vulnerabilities (TRACE/XST exploitation), missing security headers impact (clickjacking, XSS), Apache 2.4.50 CVE-2021-41773 path traversal exploitation attempts, client-side XSS in contact form, and server misconfiguration issues
targets.rationale: Apache 2.4.50 has known vulnerabilities (CVE-2021-41773). TRACE method is enabled allowing Cross-Site Tracing attacks. All security headers are missing (X-Frame-Options, CSP, HSTS, X-Content-Type-Options, X-XSS-Protection) making it vulnerable to clickjacking and XSS. Static site with minimal functionality but fundamental security issues present.

targets.objective: Test for information disclosure via verbose error messages, .htaccess content disclosure attempts, Apache server-status/server-info exposure, directory listing vulnerabilities, and file/directory enumeration to find hidden resources
targets.rationale: .htaccess file exists (returns 403) which may contain sensitive configuration. Server leaks version information in headers. Limited attack surface but comprehensive enumeration needed to ensure no hidden admin interfaces, APIs, or sensitive files exist.

targets.objective: Test contact form for client-side validation bypass, XSS injection in form fields, CSRF vulnerabilities, and potential backend processing if form handler exists despite client-side processing indication
targets.rationale: Contact form present with name, email, and message fields. Currently processes client-side only via JavaScript, but should verify no backend processing exists. Client-side validation can be bypassed. Form may be vulnerable to stored XSS if backend processing is added later.
